lead_paragraph: In several states, many government offices and schools remained closed on Monday, many roads had not yet been cleared and trash pickup was postponed.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Washington, Gary Gately from Baltimore, Jon Hurdle from Philadelphia, and Cynthia McCloud from Terra Alta, W.Va.

snippet: In several states, many government offices and schools remained closed on Monday, many roads had not yet been cleared and trash pickup was postponed.

headline.main: Some Areas Hit by East Coast Blizzard Can Only Crawl Toward Recovery
headline.print_headline: Some Areas Hit by East Coast Blizzard Can Only Crawl Toward Recovery

abstract: Millions of people face days of digging out from massive snowfall that blanketed Mid-Atlantic states from North Carolina to Massachusetts; historic blizzard brought more than three feet of snow to many areas, and snowplows will remain at work in some cities where roadways remain blocked.
